actions.committee: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources
actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

actions.in_committee: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources
actions.text: Referred to Subcommittee on Public Lands, National Parks.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Public Lands, National Parks and Forests

official_title: A bill to require the Secretary of the Interior to conduct a study to assess the suitability and feasibility of establishing a heritage corridor composed of certain sites located in the Upper Hudson River Valley, in the Champlain Valley, and in the area around Lake George, and for other purposes.
short_title: Champlain Valley Heritage Corridor Study Act

summary.text: Champlain Valley Heritage Corridor Study Act - Directs the Secretary of the Interior to study and report to specified congressional committees on the feasibility of designating as part of a national heritage corridor specified sites located in the area around the upper Hudson River, Lake Champlain, and Lake George that are thematically linked to the important conflicts that occurred between the European discovery of Lake Champlain in 1609 and the end of the Civil War. Authorizes appropriations.

titles.title: Champlain Valley Heritage Corridor Study Act

A bill to require the Secretary of the Interior to conduct a study to assess the suitability and feasibility of establishing a heritage corridor composed of certain sites located in the Upper Hudson River Valley, in the Champlain Valley, and in the area around Lake George, and for other purposes.
